critique: This executive order aims to engage faith-based organizations in delivering social services. It emphasizes non-discrimination based on religion for beneficiaries but allows faith-based organizations to maintain their religious identity. It also amends an existing executive order to prevent the exclusion of faith-based organizations from federal contracts. This suggests a slight conservative tilt due to the emphasis on faith-based organizations. The impact on immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, and economic regulation appears neutral. However, the emphasis on faith-based organizations could be seen as leaning towards conformity rather than diversity.
